events.question: I need somne fresh air. Do you wanna come with me?

events.text: You come with him as you both climb up to the top of the train.
Ah, the view is so wonderful up here.
Really?

I’ve spent most of my life with my nose in books doing research. Even when I went to London to study abroad, I never really let myself explore. I always told myself my education was more important. But… Now that I’m actually letting myself see the world, I regret all the chances I wasted before.
Hey, it's okay. I never had a chance to go on an adventure like this. I only got lucky because I met the professor.
But, unlike you, I had all these chances, and I STILL decided to not take them.

You two sit in silence for a bit, everything feeling a bit awkward.
Raj brought his knees to his chest and rocked for a little bit.
Sorry for making things awkward. It’s just … yeah. Sorry, not good at talking to people.
It’s fine. I’ve only learned how to talk to people and stuff on this journey. I kind of had bad social skills too.
Really? You seem like you got it together
You should have seen me back home. I wouldn’t have been kicked out if I had everything together.
You got kicked out of your house?
Yeah. I don’t want to say why, though. You’ll look at me differently.
Really? It can’t be that bad. You seem like a nice guy.

That’s what they all say, and then when they find out, they don’t look at me like a human anymore. I’m just.
*Sigh*
Not going to talk about it right now.

You both sit in silence for a while longer, watching the scenery pass by.
After a while, you decide to break the silence.
India is beautiful.
Yeah.
The mountains, the trees …
And, you quietly whispered.
You.
